com.networks.p2pchat

Class PostOffice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.networks.p2pchat.PostOffice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PostOffice
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Primary Post office class, will determine where messages must be sent as well as any logic behind particular message types.
    Author:
    Anthony, Jacques

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PostOffice(int port)
      The post office constructor will create the subclasses, and will start the gui login window to get user credentials.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addConversation(java.net.Socket connectionSocket)
      Add a new conversation object for a particular socket.
      void close()
      Close the thread for the post office object.
      void handleMessage(Message message)
      Handle the received message.
      void handleMessage(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String targetIp, java.lang.String targetChannel)
      This version of the handleMessage Function creates a Message object from the information supplied by the user and sends it to it's destination by placing it in the inbox.
      void initialUsernameConnectionIp(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String ip)
      Set the username and connection IP for the host, the program will hold while waiting for the username and connection ip to continue with the code.
      void run()
      Thread run loop, this function overloads the implementation from Runnable.
      void start()
      Initialize the thread for the post office.

      • initialUsernameConnectionIp

        public void initialUsernameConnectionIp(java.lang.String username,
                                        java.lang.String ip)
        Set the username and connection IP for the host, the program will hold while waiting for the username and connection ip to continue with the code. Should only be called by the graphic interface class.
        Parameters:
        username -
        ip -

      • addConversation

        Add a new conversation object for a particular socket.

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(Message message)
        Handle the received message. This will add the message to the list of messages and will notify the thread that a message is ready to be handled.

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.String targetIp,
                          java.lang.String targetChannel)
        This version of the handleMessage Function creates a Message object from the information supplied by the user and sends it to it's destination by placing it in the inbox.
        Parameters:
        message - The message object to be forwarded
        targetIp - The IP the message should be sent to.
        targetChannel - The channel that the message should be sent to.
